paragraphs.name: 97ff
paragraphs.text: You must ensure that there is always some feedback for user actions, because it makes users feel in control. Visual feedback

paragraphs.name: ee32
paragraphs.text: More you provide space int the elements more focused it will be.

paragraphs.name: 97ff
paragraphs.text: You must ensure that there is always some feedback for user actions, because it makes users feel in control. Visual feedback
A quick way to make your UI warmer and less mechanical is a human tone in the copy. If your product sounds human, it’s easier for people to trust you.

paragraphs.name: 97ff
paragraphs.text: You must ensure that there is always some feedback for user actions, because it makes users feel in control. Visual feedback

paragraphs.name: c4b4
paragraphs.text: Your product’s success is based on a combination of factors, but the overall user experience tops them all. When it comes down to designing a new app or a site, sticking to best practices is a solid way to go, but during the creation of the big picture, it’s fairly easy to skimp over design elements that feel like nice to have but not necessary. However, the difference between good and bad experiences often comes down to how thoughtful we can design these small details.

paragraphs.name: b953
paragraphs.text: Sergey, thanks for your question. Feedback is able reinforce actions. If you able to provide tactile feedback together with visual feedback in response to user-initiated actions, do it! A rule of thumb, don’t rely on a single mode of communication.
